newsitem.title: USA: US high-yld fund inflows $85.4 mln in latest week.
newsitem.headline: US high-yld fund inflows $85.4 mln in latest week.

text.p: Cash inflows to high-yield corporate bond mutual funds totaled $85.4 million in the week ended May 21, according to AMG Data Services.
The number represents a slowdown in cash flows to the funds following inflows of $374.8 million and $1.34 billion in the weeks ending May 14 and May 7, respectively.

Nevertheless, the positive number brings net cash inflows to high-yield funds to $3.12 billion in the past six weeks, compared to the $1.58 billion in outflows experienced by the same funds from mid-March to mid-April.
The numbers are tallied from high-yield bond funds that report on a weekly basis. They also exclude reinvested distributions, therefore representing only new money going into funds.
AMG, based in Arcata, Calif., is a U.S. mutual fund information company.
